alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:52PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Elbert County through 130 PM MDT... At 1250 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported funnel clouds along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Agate to 5 miles southwest of Elbert, or along a line extending from 24 miles west of Limon to 22 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of central Elbert County, which includes Fondis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
